parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Isaiah, the prophet. Of Hebrew origin; Hesaias, an Israelite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To shout, call aloud, proclaim. Apparently a prolonged form of a primary verb; to halloo, i.e. Shout.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From euthus; to straighten; technically, to steer.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
